app.control package¶

Submodules¶

app.control.device_controller module¶

async app.control.device_controller.associate_user_to_device(request)[source]¶

Associates a user to a device based on the provided user_id and device_id in the request.

Parameters:

request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request containing JSON data with user_id and device_id.

Returns:

A JSON response indicating the result of the association operation.

  • If user_id or device_id is missing, returns a 400 status with an error message.

  • If the user is not found, returns a 404 status with an error message.

  • If the device is not found, returns a 404 status with an error message.

  • If the association is successful, returns a 200 status with a success message.

  • If an exception occurs, returns a 500 status with an error message.

Return type:

Response

async app.control.device_controller.check_device_status(session: AsyncSession)[source]¶

Check the status of devices and update their status if they are inactive.

This function queries the database for all devices and checks their last updated timestamp. If a device has not been updated in the last 30 seconds, it is considered inactive and its status is updated to 0. Otherwise, the device is considered active and its status remains 1.

Parameters:

session (AsyncSession) – The database session used to execute the query.

Returns:

A summary of the status updates.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If there is an error while checking device statuses.

async app.control.device_controller.disassociate_device_from_user(request)[source]¶

Disassociates a device from a user based on the provided user_id in the request.

Parameters:

request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request containing JSON data with user_id.

Returns:

A JSON response indicating the result of the disassociation operation.

  • If user_id is missing, returns a 400 status with an error message.

  • If the user is not found, returns a 404 status with an error message.

  • If the disassociation is successful, returns a 200 status with a success message.

  • If an exception occurs, returns a 500 status with an error message.

Return type:

Response

request (web.Request) – The request object.

Returns:

A JSON response with the statuses of all devices.

async app.control.device_controller.get_all_sensor_data_for_user_device(request)[source]¶

Get all sensor data for a specific device belonging to a user.

Parameters:

request (web.Request) – The request object containing the user ID and device ID.

Returns:

A JSON response with the sensor data for the specified device and user.

web.Response

async app.control.sensor_controller.get_sensor_data_for_user(request)[source]¶

Get all sensor data from InfluxDB for a specific user based on the user_id.

Parameters:

request (web.Request) – The request object containing the user ID in the path.

Returns:

JSON response with the sensor data for the specified user.

Return type:

web.Response

async app.control.sensor_controller.list_sensor_data(request)[source]¶

Retrieve a list of all sensor data from the database.

Args: request: The request object.

Returns: JSON: A JSON response containing a list of sensor data.

Raises: Exception: If there is an error while retrieving sensor data.
